At the clinic, Doc helps a limping steer with a swollen leg, Dr. Brenda treats a urinary blockage that threatens a cats kidneys, and Dr. Lisa bandages a wounded dog.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Animals
programme.desc: Australia, a continent unto itself‚Ä¶home to scores of creatures found nowhere else in the world. Among this myriad of species is an elite group of twelve --an assembly of animals, insects, and arachnids-- equipped with an arsenal of predatory skills. Brilliantly adapted, beautiful to observe, they enthrall and amaze us. Now, witness their magnificence by journeying to their inner sanctums.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Killers
programme.desc: In the darkest corners of the world, deadly predators watch and wait for their next, unsuspecting prey. Armed with special nighttime powers, including extra-strength night vision and hypersensitive hearing, these creatures are anatomically designed to succeed in the dark.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Animals
programme.desc: Africas wild spaces host an incredible array of creatures‚Ä¶creatures who engage in a daily ballet of life and death. Among this myriad of species is an elite group of twelve --an assembly of mammals, reptiles and arachnids-- equipped with an arsenal of predator skills. Now, witness their magnificence by journeying into their inner sanctums.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: The battle between predator and prey is not always about power and strength. Knowing what lurks in the dark can mean the difference between life and death. Extraordinary powers that penetrate darkness give some creatures the edge, and the chance to live another day.
